body:
Hi. For the predators clan, we are trying to find a free server to collaborate and maybe scrimmage with each other. We are on a budget so we can't pay for a server. 

*The server will strictly be used for avicus related content. 

Conditons
-Must be free
-Can upload my own map without ftp
-(Preferably) Multicraft control panel
-24/7 Server
What I Tried Already
-Triangle
-Grattiserver
-Aternos
-The ones that need surveys....
-Envioushost

If you can help me find one that can suit the clan's needs, you will be a special guest and have full access to the server. Again, it is avicus related. Thank you for your time!

PokerFace_Legend

title: Free Server Hosting

replies.body: I would recommend that you home host, hosting from a company isn't free and not many people will be willing to pay for you.
replies.body_tagged: I would recommend that you home host, hosting from a company isn't free and not many people will be willing to pay for you.

replies.body: I would host from home but my laptop is already shitty as is so cant do anything there...
replies.body_tagged: I would host from home but my laptop is already shitty as is so cant do anything there...

reply_to.body: I would recommend that you home host, hosting from a company isn't free and not many people will be willing to pay for you.
reply_to.body_tagged: I would recommend that you home host, hosting from a company isn't free and not many people will be willing to pay for you.

replies.body: You could ask someone from your clan with a fast enough computer and a relatively quick internet speed.
replies.body_tagged: You could ask someone from your clan with a fast enough computer and a relatively quick internet speed.

reply_to.body: I would host from home but my laptop is already shitty as is so cant do anything there...
reply_to.body_tagged: I would host from home but my laptop is already shitty as is so cant do anything there...

replies.body: To host from home, you must be able to port forward, so contact your ISP and ensure that you are capable of port forwarding.
replies.body_tagged: To host from home, you must be able to port forward, so contact your ISP and ensure that you are capable of port forwarding.

replies.body: Ok I'll see what I can do. Would they be able to upload my map and change settings like allow flight ,disable mobs, whitelist, generate structures?
replies.body_tagged: Ok I'll see what I can do. Would they be able to upload my map and change settings like allow flight ,disable mobs, whitelist, generate structures?

reply_to.body: You could ask someone from your clan with a fast enough computer and a relatively quick internet speed.
reply_to.body_tagged: You could ask someone from your clan with a fast enough computer and a relatively quick internet speed.

replies.body: Most ISPs don't block port 25565, and don't you configure port forwarding in the router settings?
replies.body_tagged: Most ISPs don't block port 25565, and don't you configure port forwarding in the router settings?

reply_to.body: To host from home, you must be able to port forward, so contact your ISP and ensure that you are capable of port forwarding.
reply_to.body_tagged: To host from home, you must be able to port forward, so contact your ISP and ensure that you are capable of port forwarding.

replies.body:
With Vanilla:

- Allowing flight - Unsure
- Disable mobs - True
- Whitelist - True
- Generate structures, if you mean like villages, strongholds ect ect: True
replies.body_tagged:
With Vanilla:

- Allowing flight - Unsure
- Disable mobs - True
- Whitelist - True
- Generate structures, if you mean like villages, strongholds ect ect: True

reply_to.body: Ok I'll see what I can do. Would they be able to upload my map and change settings like allow flight ,disable mobs, whitelist, generate structures?
reply_to.body_tagged: Ok I'll see what I can do. Would they be able to upload my map and change settings like allow flight ,disable mobs, whitelist, generate structures?

replies.body: A lot of ISP's pre-configure routers, therefore giving you no choice.
replies.body_tagged: A lot of ISP's pre-configure routers, therefore giving you no choice.

reply_to.body: Most ISPs don't block port 25565, and don't you configure port forwarding in the router settings?
reply_to.body_tagged: Most ISPs don't block port 25565, and don't you configure port forwarding in the router settings?

replies.body:
There are no completely free hosting services that are not scams/surveys.

It's actually quite easy to set up a home server with port forwarding, and there's plenty of step-by-step tutorials on YouTube.

There are no major limitations to a home server, except for limited server ram (since it's your own computer) and having to start your server up whenever you use it.

For a scrimmage server, home hosting should work fine.
replies.body_tagged:

It's actually quite easy to set up a home server with port forwarding, and there's plenty of step-by-step tutorials on YouTube.

There are no major limitations to a home server, except for limited server ram (since it's your own computer) and having to start your server up whenever you use it.

For a scrimmage server, home hosting should work fine.

replies.body: I just would like to remember that when you port forward your router, all the devices who are connected to the network are going to be vulnerable because when you port forward the router firewall won't protect you.
replies.body_tagged: I just would like to remember that when you port forward your router, all the devices who are connected to the network are going to be vulnerable because when you port forward the router firewall won't protect you.

replies.body: Ok. That's bad because many people use the wifi.
replies.body_tagged: Ok. That's bad because many people use the wifi.

reply_to.body: I just would like to remember that when you port forward your router, all the devices who are connected to the network are going to be vulnerable because when you port forward the router firewall won't protect you.
reply_to.body_tagged: I just would like to remember that when you port forward your router, all the devices who are connected to the network are going to be vulnerable because when you port forward the router firewall won't protect you.

replies.body: Also, I forgot to add this earlier but, it would help if the server was 24/7.
replies.body_tagged: Also, I forgot to add this earlier but, it would help if the server was 24/7.

replies.body: It depends whether they provide the router or not. Even if the ISP does, its pretty easy to contact them, and forward the port.
replies.body_tagged: It depends whether they provide the router or not. Even if the ISP does, its pretty easy to contact them, and forward the port.

reply_to.body: A lot of ISP's pre-configure routers, therefore giving you no choice.
reply_to.body_tagged: A lot of ISP's pre-configure routers, therefore giving you no choice.

There is one....  Aternos.net
 , most is in English just make a account, then you verify it (no surveys or anything) and then you can add plugins and everything! I've used this a lot!
Your welcome :0
